description: From Joannes Neper, the Latinized name of John Napier, a Scottish mathematician.

entries.meaning: (electronics) A non-SI unit of the attenuation (or sometimes gain) of field and power quantities such as electronic signals; the natural logarithm of a ratio, with 1 Np (a ratio of 2.718:1) being equivalent to 8.686 dB.
examples: Values of b, the amplitude attenuation constant, are given for various materials in Table 1.1. Having dimensions of [length]-1, it is usually measured in nepers per centimetre (Np cm-1).
